docs.snippet: Attorney General Jeff Sessions recused himself from an investigation into any ties between Moscow and President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign Thursday after revelations that he talked with Russia's ambassador to the United States twice during the p...
docs.lead_paragraph: Attorney General Jeff Sessions recused himself from an investigation into any ties between Moscow and President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign Thursday after revelations that he talked with Russia's ambassador to the United States twice during the presidential campaign. Sessions had faced mounting pressure from both parties on Capitol Hill that he step aside or resign.

headline.main: A Look at the Known Ties Between Trump Associates and Russia
headline.print_headline: A Look at the Known Ties Between Trump Associates and Russia

docs.snippet: To say actress Zoey Deutch is a regular at Art's Deli is an understatement. Sporting an oversized sweatshirt, she breezes into the restaurant, a Studio City institution since 1957, and is immediately greeted with familiar hugs from the wait staff....
docs.lead_paragraph: To say actress Zoey Deutch is a regular at Art's Deli is an understatement. Sporting an oversized sweatshirt, she breezes into the restaurant, a Studio City institution since 1957, and is immediately greeted with familiar hugs from the wait staff. One chimes in that he's known her since she was a baby.

headline.main: Zoey Deutch Carves Her Own Path in Hollywood
headline.print_headline: Zoey Deutch Carves Her Own Path in Hollywood

docs.snippet: Government employees in California cannot keep the public from seeing their work-related emails and texts sent on personal devices and through private accounts, the California Supreme Court ruled unanimously Thursday, closing a loophole that justi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Government employees in California cannot keep the public from seeing their work-related emails and texts sent on personal devices and through private accounts, the California Supreme Court ruled unanimously Thursday, closing a loophole that justices said could have allowed the "most sensitive and potentially damning" communications to be shielded.

headline.main: Court: Officials' Emails on Private Accounts Are Public
headline.print_headline: Court: Officials' Emails on Private Accounts Are Public
